data.title: Failed to activate the tree-view package
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Launch app

**Atom Version**: 0.188.0
**System**: linux 3.10.0-031000-generic
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Failed to activate the tree-view package

```
At EACCES, permission denied '/home/rafvall/.atom/compile-cache/less/e1251573b94229de3a9ca9779a708bc3ffe3707e/content/0b632fd6070c75db68b3a73fd1afcf31224a3712/select-list.json'

Error: EACCES, permission denied '/home/rafvall/.atom/compile-cache/less/e1251573b94229de3a9ca9779a708bc3ffe3707e/content/0b632fd6070c75db68b3a73fd1afcf31224a3712/select-list.json'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:503:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:118:20)
    at Object.fs.writeFileSync (fs.js:1116:15)
    at Object.fsPlus.writeFileSync (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/fs-plus/lib/fs-plus.js:246:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.writeJson (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:155:17)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.putCachedCss (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:225:19)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.cssForFile (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:276:12)
    at LessCache.module.exports.LessCache.readFileSync (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/less-cache/lib/less-cache.js:263:19)
    at LessCompileCache.module.exports.LessCompileCache.read (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/less-compile-cache.js:36:25)
```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "monokai"
    ],
    "autoHideMenuBar": true
  },
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {}
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
atom-alignment, v0.11.0
color-picker, v1.4.4
docblockr, v0.6.3
emmet, v2.3.4
jslint, v1.2.0
linter, v0.12.0
monokai, v0.12.0
prefixr, v0.2.0

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: One Dark syntax theme colors all Java code yellow
data.body:
Here's a screenshot of the issue:
![Screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/sYIOndC.png)
I've seen the same issue in Sublime themes as well but I never quite figured out the problem.

data.title: Uncaught Error: ENOENT,  not found in /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/atom.asar
data.body:
This one is easy to reproduce in my environment.

/opt/atom is where I have atom installed
$ pwd
/opt/atom/share/atom/resources
$ ls -lsn
total 116
  4 drwxrwxr-x. 15 1000 1000   4096 Mar 27 01:22 app
112 -rw-rw-r--.  1 1000 1000 112711 Mar 27 01:22 atom.asar

[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. cd /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/
2. atom
3. click "atom.asar" in tree view

**Atom Version**: 0.188.0-d462895
**System**: linux 3.19.1-201.fc21.i686
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: ENOENT,  not found in /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/atom.asar

```
At /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/workspace.js:518

Error: ENOENT,  not found in /opt/atom/share/atom/resources/atom.asar
    at createNotFoundError (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:101:13)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as open] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:156:25)
    at ReadStream.open (fs.js:1630:6)
    at new ReadStream (fs.js:1617:10)
    at Object.fs.createReadStream (fs.js:1571:10)
    at File.module.exports.File.read (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/file.js:307:27)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.updateCachedDiskContents (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:1009:61)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.load (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:1033:19)
    at Project.module.exports.Project.buildBuffer (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/project.js:507:21)
    at Project.module.exports.Project.bufferForPath (/opt/atom/share/atom/resources/app/src/project.js:477:63)
```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "excludeVcsIgnoredPaths": false,
    "autoHideMenuBar": true
  },
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "autoIndentOnPaste": false,
    "showInvisibles": true,
    "softWrap": true,
    "fontSize": 14
  }
}

# Dev
No dev packages

data.title: Failing loading module in Atom package
Bump image-view@0.53.0
data.body: Use the latest version of `image-view` which uses the latest version of the `status-bar` Services API :peach:

data.title: Bump feedback@0.36.0
data.body: Use the latest version of `feedback` which uses the latest version of the `status-bar` services API :palm_tree:

data.title: utf markdown html mangled
data.body:
It seems like utf-8 symbols are mangled when saving a markdown file as html (on OSX Yosemite).

For example:

> # Example
> 
> The More You Know™
> 
> ಠ_ಠ

is rendered as the following html:

> Example
> 
> The More You Knowâ„¢
> 
> à² _à² 

It shows up fine using the built-in Markdown Preview.

data.title: LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810.
data.body:
Atom crashes every time when I try to open it, from command line and from dock. It crashes immediately after opening, I can't even see the window. I have used atom in my computer few months with out any problem.

When opening atom from terminal it prints following message every time:

```
LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810.
```

And OS X opens "Problem Report for Atom" window.

It contains following information

```
Process:         Atom [27076]
Path:            /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom
Identifier:      com.github.atom
Version:         ???
Code Type:       X86-64 (Native)
Parent Process:  launchd [353]
Responsible:     Atom [27076]
User ID:         501

Date/Time:       2015-03-27 23:58:27.061 +0200
OS Version:      Mac OS X 10.9.5 (13F1066)
Report Version:  11

...

Crashed Thread:  0

Exception Type:  EXC_BREAKPOINT (SIGTRAP)
Exception Codes: 0x0000000000000002, 0x0000000000000000

Application Specific Information:
dyld: launch, loading dependent libraries

Dyld Error Message:
  Library not loaded: @rpath/libchromiumcontent.dylib
  Referenced from: /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Framework.framework/Versions/A/Atom Framework
  Reason: image not found

Binary Images:
    0x7fff6e412000 -     0x7fff6e445817  dyld (239.4) <7AD43B9B-5CEA-3C7E-9836-A06909F9CA56> /usr/lib/dyld
    0x7fff855f1000 -     0x7fff855f1fff  com.apple.Carbon (154 - 157) <45A9A40A-78FF-3EA0-8FAB-A4F81052FA55> /System/Library/Frameworks/Carbon.framework/Versions/A/Carbon
    0x7fff8727d000 -     0x7fff87419ff3  com.apple.QuartzCore (1.8 - 332.3) <72003E51-1287-395B-BCBC-331597D45C5E> /System/Library/Frameworks/QuartzCore.framework/Versions/A/QuartzCore
    0x7fff8ee6d000 -     0x7fff8eebffff  libc++.1.dylib (120) <4F68DFC5-2077-39A8-A449-CAC5FDEE7BDE> /usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib
    0x7fff90102000 -     0x7fff90103ff7  libSystem.B.dylib (1197.1.1) <E303F2F8-A8CF-3DF3-84B3-F2D0EE41CCF6> /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib

data.title: "Search in Directory" not working when root directory name contains a period
data.body:
The `Search in Directory` command does not seem to work properly when there are multiple root folders (as below illustrates), but works as expected with a single root folder.

![out2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4972683/6877472/28c9901c-d4c9-11e4-8a38-43f743cbcf35.gif)

I'm on Ubuntu 14.10 and v0.188.0 of Atom.

data.title: Symantec Endpoint Protection reported Atom as trying to edit the hosts file
data.body:
Windows 7
Atom Version 0.188.0

When I opened atom, My endpoint protection popped up a threat detection alert saying that atom was attempting to edit my hosts file. then stopped the app from running.

data.title: Bump deprecation-cop@0.38.0
data.body: Use the latest version of `deprecation-cop` which uses the latest version of the `status-bar` Service API. :cat2:

data.title: Bump settings-view@0.186.0
data.body:
The latest version of `settings-view` which is using the latest version of the `status-bar` Service API.

:balloon:

data.title: Multiple keys keybindings interfering with the built in ones
data.body:
Hi,

It seems like when assigning a keybinding like **ctrl + m + o** triggers the **ctrl + o** keybinding.
Is this expected?

``` cson
// Example config that won't work
'atom-workspace atom-text-editor:not([mini])':
  'ctrl-m o': 'editor:fold-all'
```

Thanks

data.title: Folding toggle command
data.body:
Hi,

Currently Atom has 2 different commands for folding/unfolding the current row: 
1. editor:fold-current-row 
2. editor:unfold-current-row

But it seems more logical to have just one row folding toggle command, and use to fold/unfold a block.

This is more like a feature request, it seems that both Atom and SublimeText are missing this, and Visual Studio gets it right. The fold all behaviour of Atom is much better than Sublime's though.

Thank you.

data.title: Conflict ignored when changing file outside of Atom when it has unsaved changes in Atom.
data.body: I have a clean local file `foo` open in Atom, and I modify the file outside Atom. Atom reloads the file, which is fine. But if I have unsaved changes in file `foo` in Atom, and `foo` gets modified externally, Atom does not tell me about external changes, even when I try to save the file.

data.title: Fix double autoscroll when moving cursor
data.body: Fixes #6126

data.title: Weird scroll jump when scrolling and then clicking in a buffer
data.body:
When a scroll in the editor put the cursor out of the screen and then clicking in the buffer to put the cursor somewhere, the editor's scroll unexpectedly changes.

![atom-scroll-jump-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/6872742/66c042ee-d4ab-11e4-8a31-f80abdf2835f.gif)

data.title: Add support for checkmarks in the menu
data.body:
It would be really nice if there will be support for adding a checkmark in front of a menu item in Atom API. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11520795/6871957/cf4b211e-d4ae-11e4-8a3f-2d827fd9323b.png)

It may be useful to easy access some setting that change very often for an Atom package.

data.title: Manually set Syntax Highlighting
data.body: I am a Sublime user now i moved to Atom, How can i choose Syntax highlighting for a selected text? IN Sublime View ->Syntax ->HTML. Do we have something similar?

data.title: 75% of the Atom window is not used.
data.body:
This is how the window appears in whatever size window it is.  No way to close/hide/do anything with it.
![screen shot 2015-03-27 at 9 28 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7141481/6868682/ffca8172-d463-11e4-8c13-731d0bccefba.png)

data.title: same value not focused
data.body: when double click the variable is focusing same value

data.title: Deprecation Cop: Check for duplicate issue before creating new
data.body: The Deprecation Cop encourages users to create issues on repositories when deprecated features are being used. This may lead to a lot of [duplicate issues](https://github.com/awatson1978/meteor-api/issues).

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'screenDelta' of undefined
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. ...
2. ...

**Atom Version**: 0.188.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace
